sn22.59:2.3: Also at [mn35:13.4](). This responds to the “inner controller” (_antaryāmin_) of Bṛhadāraṇyaka Upaniṣad 3.7. Uddālaka, having learned this from the centaur Kabandha in Madra (near modern Islamabad), challenges Yājñavalkya, who explains it as the self who lives in the midst of all things, unknown but knowing, controlling all from within.
